greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into 2 distinct primes.
comment: Number of distinct rectangles with prime length and width such that L + W = n, W < L. For example, a(16) = 2; the two rectangles are 3 X 13 and 5 X 11. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Oct 29 2017
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{j>0} Sum_{i=1..j-1} x^(p(i)+p(j)), where p(k) is the k-th prime.
G.f.: A(x)^2/2 - A(x^2)/2 where A(x) = Sum_{p in primes} x^p. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Nov 21 2012
a(n) = Sum_{i=2..floor((n-1)/2)} A010051(i) * A010051(n-i). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Oct 29 2017
mathematica: l = {}; For[n = 1, n <= 1000, n++, c = 0; For[k = 1, Prime[k] < n/2, k++, If[PrimeQ[n - Prime[k]], c = c + 1] ]; AppendTo[l, c] ] l (* _Jake Foster_, Oct 27 2008 *)
Table[Count[IntegerPartitions[n,{2}],_?(AllTrue[#,PrimeQ]&&#[[1]]!= #[[2]] &)],{n,120}] (* Requires Mathematica version 10 or later *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jul 26 2020 *)
xref: Column k=2 of A219180. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 13 2012
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Apr 03 2006
